page.title: 13Park Hall Country Park
page.content: The history of the park is varied. Thention of the land is in a document stating the land to be a deer park owned by the Coney family in 1449.It remained in that family until the seventeenth century when it was sold to the Parker family.This family gave its name to the Park Hall area.In the nineteenth century the first sandstone quarries were opened.Between 1939 and 1970 extensive quarrying of sand and gravel took place.After 1970 sand and gravel extraction stopped.The park became what can only be described as a rubbish tip. The park area was taken over by Stoke-on-Trent and Staffordshire councils and the complete area was reclaimed.The former quarry faces were made safe and turned into attractive canyons.Car parks,walkways,
